Author: thehun
Title: [ANN] bitJob: Decentralized Student Marketplace for Online Jobs | Crowdsale Soon
Body: Student Job Market Startup bitJob Connects with UK ATM Company  http://bitcoinist.com/student-job-market-startup-bitjob-connects-uk-atm-company/  Student work marketplace bitJob have this week announced a collaboration deal with BCB ATM UK. This will effectively provide a convenient ‘Point Of Exit’ for students (in the UK at least), wishing to cash out their earnings for jobs undertaken through the service.  So What’s a bitJob?  In an ever more competitive job market, University leavers need relevant work experience just to get a foot in the door. Not to mention the fact that some extra cash to fund that fancy student lifestyle wouldn’t go amiss.  At the same time, many employers find it hard to source reliable, skilled and cost effective talent. This is especially true for short term contracts and piecework.  bitJob aims to sit squarely between the two camps and play matchmaker. Students will build a Dynamic Portfolio Resume (DPR) of the work undertaken. This can also be used to apply for graduate positions outside of the service. Employers can view this DPR along with a students reputation profile, to help choose the right candidate.  bitJob Co-founder and CMO Elad Kofman explains:         Show Me the Money  Students can use the service for free and are paid in bitJob tokens (STU) on completion of work. The tokens are being developed on the Ethereum blockchain, and there will also be an option for employers to make payments in Fiat via PayPal.  To encourage participation and promotion within universities, the students’ unions will receive a commission on each transaction through an affiliate program. This will come from fees paid by employers who use the service.   STU tokens will also be available for trade by investors, and the company is currently undertaking funding at the Pre-ICO stage. Pre-sale investors are even being offered a free Trezor hardware wallet.  More information on the service is available in the whitepaper.   And What Can I do with STU?  Outlets on campus will be encouraged to accept STU tokens for items and services such as coffee, study materials, haircuts, etc. As uptake of the program grows, this will open them up to new markets.  Students and investors will also be able to convert STU tokens on exchanges, and bitJob intends to maximize the number of exchanges on which this is possible. It will also be possible to transfer STU to other students (e.g. for that pint your mate had to lend you the money for last night).  Finally, with this weeks announcement, UK students will be able to use their STU to withdraw cash from ATM machines run by BCB ATM UK. And as we all know, for students, nothing talks quite like hard cash.  Landry Ntahe, BCB ATM UK Head of Operations, states:       We aim to facilitate users on the Bitjob platform the means to exchange tokens across the UK through our BCB ATM’s

Author: wintwowin
Title: [ANN] bitJob: Decentralized Student Marketplace for Online Jobs | Crowdsale Soon
Body: This is good question and we have plans to deal with those issues.  1. Rating/reputation system will be in place which will allow both student and employer rate each other. When hiring employer and students when undertaking the work will be able to review those ratings.  2. Students will be able to build resume based on the work and tasks provided to employers, this way any unfavorable ratings would show up.  3. We will implement escrow service for additional fees and both employer and the student will be able to signup for this service to protect themselves. This way payments can be released according to the milestones and only after both parties sign off. Both parties would have to come to terms themselves for money to be released or returned.  4. We are considering options to dedicate certain percentage of fees towards members contributing to the community who could support arbitration process and conflict resolution.  Bogdan Fiedur

Body: Hi Everyone,  I want to address 3 issues we get ask all of the time.  Why are we so unique? First, bitJob is unique because of its awesome team, backers, and partners. We have signed several build agreements with Universities, Blockchain Partners, Employers & student unions. Every care is taken to provide incentive to the students to increase their reputation on the platform and maintain it at the highest level. Students on bitJob will enjoy a variety of incentives, Including free FIAT-to-STU exchanges fees, free Transaction fees on a 2-sided students transaction, and Collaborations with businesses around campuses.  What is the bitJob's Reputation Model? bitJob participants will have reputation assigned to them, to enable them to access remuneration appropriate to their skill level. The better the individual’s reputation, based on previous bitJobs, the higher the price they will be able to command for an hour’s work.  bitJob's Affiliate program We're launching our affiliate marketing plan for spreading the word around the world. In order to reach as many students as possible, we've came up with a wonderful reward program that will provide our partners with referee rewards and partners fees on each new registrant. Author: wintwowin
Title: [ANN] bitJob: Decentralized Student Marketplace for Online Jobs | Crowdsale Soon
Body: Hello rhinomonkey,   Thank you for asking this question.  The plan is to build blockchain solution and record both PayPal and STU necessary activity on the blockchain.  Tasks like member registration, job posting, interviews, job engagement and completion will be stored on the blockchain ( or necessary minimum related to those tasks).  Users will then have the option to choose method of payment. In case they choose to use PayPal, our role will be to make the payment to them in form of FIAT. This might include some conversion fees. We will partner with organizations/exchanges which offer such conversions.  The end result to the user will be that they will receive their pay in the selected currency. Choosing FIAT will have obvious disadvantage in form of additional fees, while choosing STU will have no fees attached to it, other than fees of using Ethereum network and platform fee.  With the time, students will become familiar with the platform and switching to STU will be as hard as making choice in the drop down of available payments.  Allowing FIAT transaction in the platform will increase adoption of  bitjob.io  Once the market becomes more liquid we will work with University facilities like cafeterias, book stores to accept payments in STU.  Possibly down the road more merchants will accept Bitcoin as form of payment and accepting STU will only either require converting to BTC through e.g. ShapeShift or paying directly to the merchant.    We believe this future is not very distant.  Bogdan Fiedur Bitjob CTO
